snippet: Under the agreement, BP will be allowed to bid for new leases as early as next Wednesday, but only as long as the company passes muster on ethics, corporate governance and safety procedures.
abstract: BP, four years removed from 2010 Deepwater Horizon rig explosion, reaches agreement with Environmental Protection Agency to seek new oil leases in Gulf of Mexico; bids are allowed only as long as company passes muster on ethics, corporate governance and safety procedures; agreement means hundreds of millions of dollars in new business for company.

byline.contributor: Campbell Robertson contributed reporting from New Orleans.

lead_paragraph: Under the agreement, BP will be allowed to bid for new leases as early as next Wednesday, but only as long as the company passes muster on ethics, corporate governance and safety procedures.

headline.main: U.S. Agrees to Allow BP Back Into Gulf Waters to Seek Oil
headline.print_headline: U.S. Agrees to Allow BP Back Into Gulf Waters to Seek Oil
